John Milosevic

Dear Readers
 I would like to share with you the way our school's education system is in Washington D.C.
 Some schools across the nation, but not many, have what we call down here an ARC. It is short for Acedemic Resource Center. Now, let me tell you a bit about it. When a child is struggling with calculus, math, history, english, or science, we have a bundle of people in their willing to help. Now, at most of the high schools, we have an ARC with four tutors that were either former teachers or college professors. We have four teachers. One does science, one does Social studies, one does math, and the other does English. 
 Now, many schools have these, but are not for normal people like you and me. Some schools have what I call a special education room. Also called a learning center. Now, they should open more ARC'S around the nation. This would certainly help our children. I know it helped mine. My daughter was having trouble with her AP calculus, and she went in and got help from the math tutor. Within a day, she was undrestanding it.
 Now, I think all schools should have these, because with a little tutoring, these kids can understand and possibly do better in school.
 We all want our kids to suceed in school don't we?
 Well, I have sent some struggling kids in my science and Calculus classes down to the ARC when they were strugling. I am talking, a failing grade, and not understanding a damn thing about the criteria.
 Now, a few days after I sent them down there, they came back understanding it, and in a few weeks, they raised their grade to a passing grade. I recently came out of retirement, and am teaching calculus and science at a high school. But, ever since the ARC came to power a month ago, I have seen so many kids getting better at math and science, and many of my co-workers say the same to me. Now, granted, not everyone will get better at math after the ARC. They have to go down maybe once a week, or more, and spend atleast an hour with whoever and they will see results.
 My daughter was failing calculus, I mean failing, and she spend two days a week down there, and, she became a passing student in no time.
 So, why aren't all schools doing this? I mean, high school is more important than middle school. High school will tell the future of your life. Middle school, my youngest, she mostly lays back. But, my oldest, this is the time to see what colleges she is getting into, and whether or not she is able to handle the real world. But, this would be important in high school. I have taught decades. I have seen so much struggle. This is such a good idea. So, again, why are the other schools in the nation not doing this?
 I did a little research. My father said in Albequrkue or however you spell it, is doing this program. My neice in Rapid City says her schools have them down there.
 Washington D.C. has them, and I have taught at Boston, they have them. We need them in every high school in the nation. Now, some kids don't need one. They can just go and ask ol' dad for some help, but, what if he is not home? SOme kids ask their teachers, but, lets save a hassle. Lets ask the tutors.
 Why isn't every school in Amerika doing this? My philosophy is that if their is help, they will come. 
 -Dr. John Milosevic
Iuris

E, pa sta znamo. Najveroatnije ti je to kao uvek u skolama: nema love za dodatne programe. Nema bas mnogo ljudi koji ce da uce a da nisu placeni, tuzna istina sveta.
 
 P.S. What are you a doctor of, anyway? Seems a bit strange that you yourself, being a teacher and all, couldn't help your daugter with her calculus... Btw, did your spouse have any trouble giving birth, what with you being retired already and having daughters still in school, that would sound as a late in life childbirth, and those can get risky...
Wez

Why don't they just ask the teachers? That's what the teachers are there for after all.
 
 -Wez
snakespit

Dr. John? Get real. Let me ask you something. Why do you feel you need to lie in all of your posts, and make up outrageous claims. It does nothing but make you look like an XXX. I would bet that anyone who ever looked at your profile instantly knew that you are completely full of #$%$. 
 
 For anyone that has not read his public profile:
 
Date of Birth:
 November 29, 1967 
 Age:
 38

 Professer at Washington, close advisor to the president. Brother of Bosnian genocidal maniac Slubgdan Milosevic. 
 Location:
 Washington D.C. 
 Interests:
 Sex 
 Occupation:
 Political Advisor to Bush, teach philosophy and political sciences at Washington D.C. 

 
 Wait...I thought you post said that you were a high school calc teacher, not a poly sci prof. Why do you even bother to waste your time here. Start taking your meds!!!
Iuris
I would also like to point out that he has to date never reacted to my posts, which intentionally include Serbian language. Strange, eh?
snakespit

I also find this kind of curious: 
 
 
I am a doctor at the University of Washinton D.C. and a close political analyst to the White house. I have assignments assigned by the government and I basically tell them my beleifs and what I am seeing and I give them a solution to save the American life.

 
 
I predict that North Korea, Russia, and China will attack America, and Bush beleives it too. I am close friends with Bush, and he beleives it too.

 
 
I am a Dr. of Political sciences at the University of Washington. 

 
 
I am also a doctor of philosophy.

 
 
and beleive it or not, I am a close friend of the President. I should not be leaking this, but, we tortured a Iraqi prisoner, and he told us the location to Saddam Hussein.

 
 
I would Like you all to know, that I am trying to start a web page. ut I can't. I am a doctor at the State University. When I left my past life behind me, I went to school and got my decree in philosophy and political sciences. I am a doctor at the state college here in Rapid City. If you all have political views and want my long studied and personal perspective on government, world affairs, European fears that the government does not tell you about, philosophy, the new age of American government, or maybe a little philosophy on what a great government would be instead of the Amerikan government (dream government better than the current government) e-mail me. My name is Dr. Sam Grevano. Please e-mail your concerns, questions about political views to annielledellacroce@yahoo.com
 Thanks

 
 All of the above quotes provided by: Sammy Grevano Hmmm...sounds strangely similar to someone else who posts here...Doesn't he Dr. John?
 
 My big question is: What makes someone act like this? I am really curious about this kind of thing. Is this just an immature kid with an overactive imagination, or is there pathology here?
Iuris
Seems I/we have missed a bit of forum background and past. What are you talking about, exactly, snakespit?
John Milosevic

Dear Snakespit and Mr. Serbian
 I used to teach political sciences at a college in Washington D.C. and when I retired, I became a substitute teacher. Now, I came out of my retirement a few weeks ago to become a calculus and a chemistry teacher. I am a doctor in math. Now, I am not a kid. I am not Sally Grevano or whatever. I have admitted before that I am not Milosevics brother. But, I have the same last name, and come from that general area. Now, I have explained most of your questions. Also, I have admitted to not being a white house advisor. I m sorry. Now, please just quit bothering me. I am not a kid. I am telling you that. Now, please, if you can't agree or disagree with me in a more well mannered way, please just don't reply to me posts. I may have lied back then, but you all just don't think outside the box. Just because I was a professor at a college and hold a doctrate in math and politics, does not mean that I can't teach high schoolers. Now, please, let me post.
 Any questons?
Iuris
Sure I have a question, did you understand anything of what I wrote in serbian?
snakespit

Seems I/we have missed a bit of forum background and past. What are you talking about, exactly, snakespit?

 That Dr. John is actually the same person as this Sammy Grevano, who also stated many of the same lies. That this person is obviously not who or what he says. That no credibility can be attached to his posts. Take your pick. My bigger question is why would someone do this?
snakespit

Dear Snakespit and Mr. Serbian
 I used to teach political sciences at a college in Washington D.C. and when I retired, I became a substitute teacher.  What college did you teach at? I want to look in the directory to find your name.
 What school do you presently teach at?
 Where did you earn your doctorates? 
 Why should we grant you any credibility when you have admitted to such obvious lies already?
John Milosevic

Iurius, I did understand what you said. Second, I taught at a number of diffrent colleges. I currently teach calculus and science at a local high school, and earned my doctrate in 1987. Now, I am sticking with what i said. Now, I am not lying. I admit, I have lied about the "I am related to Slobo, and I am a advisor or a friend of Bush."
 I admitted to that a long time ago. The stuf I say now a day, is true. I have not lied since I wrote that apology post months back. I have just posted my views, and I get atacked. I wonder sometimes if the people who attack me are liberals, democrats, or both. What I am saying is not only being said by me 'we need more arc's' a lot of states want these in their schools. The whole school lunch thing, not just my view on it. A hell of a lot of people agree with it. Listen, just please leave me alone if you can't stick with the original post. I wanted views on my idea and all of a sudden, we turn this into attack John hour. 
 Please, just realize, I am just expressing my views, and the views of many I know. 
 I don't expect you to agree with them, or disagree with them. I expect to be heard and atleast walk away knowing that you understand where I am coming from.
 -John
Iuris
Ok, so why don't YOU respond to the issues I raised in serbian? After all, the consideration I pointed out is hardly irrelevant to the main topic...
Dono

John - As an admitted liar, you should understand our reluctance to believe you. I am from a time when it was understood that a man is only as good as his word. To restore some creditability, all you have to do is tell us what university you received your doctorate from. It is time to put up or shut up.
 Dono
snakespit

Nothing John? Well, allow me then. 
 
 http://www.k12.dc.us/dcps/curriculum/dccurriculumhome.html
 
 Strangely, there seems to be no mention of an ARC anywhere on the DCPS website. You would think that an innovative and model program like this would at least earn some small measure of mention on the website...right? Or perhaps our boy Dr. John works for some "other" DC school district?
Justawoman

You know if I had my doctorate in Math as good ole John says I think I could tutor my own daughter in calculus. That alone is very strange that he can't do that or teach it well enough that students in his classroom can't grasp what he is teaching. It really doesn't add up.
 
 I do know that the ARC thing he mentions is similar to what is set up in our school district here. The students get a free period to go get homework help during school.
snakespit

You know if I had my doctorate in Math as good ole John says I think I could tutor my own daughter in calculus. That alone is very strange that he can't do that or teach it well enough that students in his classroom can't grasp what he is teaching. It really doesn't add up.
 
 I do know that the ARC thing he mentions is similar to what is set up in our school district here. The students get a free period to go get homework help during school.

 I known that there are actually ARC's out there, actually much more prevelent in colleges than high schools...although many high schools are starting to adopt the concept. I just figured that something like this would be listed on the DCPS website, but yet I find absolutely no mention of it, even with the search feature. 
 
 He also claims to have a double doctorate...or at least he was claiming that at one point. I just wonder what kind of genious can earn 2 PhD's by the age of 19 or 20, yet still spells doctorate "doctrate". Truth is I don't buy anything he has said, and I will not in the future.
Jo Bennett

 Well someone who is dyslexic and has science of maths PhDs, I suppose. Though in order to get them by age 20 he'd either have to do them both simultaneously or start when he was 13.

 I agree though that he is not very credible sounding.

 Second, I taught at a number of diffrent colleges.

 I currently teach calculus and science at a local high school, and earned my doctrate in 1987.
 

 Which high school, and which district?, I already asked you where you earned your doctorate.

They can just go and ask ol' dad for some help, but, what if he is not home? SOme kids ask their teachers, but, lets save a hassle. Lets ask the tutors.
 Why isn't every school in Amerika doing this? My philosophy is that if their is help, they will come. 
 -Dr. John Milosevic

 
 
 
 Our school's teachers ALL will arrange to meet with a student if they want to, and most have hours where you can come in without an appointment. Learning takes work. ARC won't be magic, it takes work. I don't know how it works, but for every subject we have acedemic support. If you need math help you can go into the room and there will be a math teacher to help you. Same with english, history, science, etc. This works fine. There are still people who refuse to go because they don't want to learn, but for the people who are motivated and just have some questions, it works great.
Iuris

Sure, Zahvac, it was more to prove that he was lying. While I am not actually a Serb (1/4 only, but I'm fully Slovenian), we studied the "serbo-croat" hybrid language in school, obligatory content for all pupils of Yugoslavia at the time. While the Serbian and the Croat language are different, it's a matter of detail: a Croat will fully understand a Serb talking. The distinctions barely go beyond the differences between US and UK english. ANY Serb, Bosnian, Montenegran or Croat, plus an overwhelming majority of Slovenians and macedonians would understand what I wrote. Translations follow:
 
 
E, pa sta znamo. Najveroatnije ti je to kao uvek u skolama: nema love za dodatne programe. Nema bas mnogo ljudi koji ce da uce a da nisu placeni, tuzna istina sveta.

 
 "Well, what do we know. Most likely, it is the same as ever when it comes to schools: no money for extra programs. There aren't many people willing to teach without getting paid, a sad truth of the world."
 
 If he had read it and understood it, he would have known that it is actually an answer to his original issue, enough to continue the conversation. My interpretation is, he didn't get it.
zachvac

Sure, Zahvac, it was more to prove that he was lying. While I am not actually a Serb (1/4 only, but I'm fully Slovenian), we studied the "serbo-croat" hybrid language in school, obligatory content for all pupils of Yugoslavia at the time. While the Serbian and the Croat language are different, it's a matter of detail: a Croat will fully understand a Serb talking. The distinctions barely go beyond the differences between US and UK english. ANY Serb, Bosnian, Montenegran or Croat, plus an overwhelming majority of Slovenians and macedonians would understand what I wrote. Translations follow:
 
 
 
 "Well, what do we know. Most likely, it is the same as ever when it comes to schools: no money for extra programs. There aren't many people willing to teach without getting paid, a sad truth of the world."
 
 If he had read it and understood it, he would have known that it is actually an answer to his original issue, enough to continue the conversation. My interpretation is, he didn't get it.

Of course that's only if your real interest is actual debate. If you want to continue to make things up people will continue to realize you are lying. Also, wouldn't a double doctorate realize that there's probably somewhere on the internet that could translate that phrase into Serbian even if he didn't know it?

Why would someone lie like this? I am not Milosevic guys. I am a simple ordinary teacher. I just ask, why would Johnny boy lie to us and be someone he is not? It is pretty pathetic when you stop and think about it. Not only that, but, it is a waste of this websites time. This website was not made for skepticism and debate over identity, and that is what John is turning it into. 
 He has not replied to any of our posts which usually appear to put words in his mouth and give him the chance to state his lies. Why does he not reply? I said some stuff in a earlier post about him being a liar and all that, he has yet to reply. Is he still with us? Oh, I know, he is probably busy teaching AP calculus or some XXXX.
 Anyway, thank you Zack. Are you really a kid? Criminy, you are a pretty smart kid, and I wish my whole school was full of kids like you.
